programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2024 Wimbledon Championships
programme.desc: From the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club in Wimbledon, England.

programme.title: Wimbledon - Second Serve
programme.desc: Highlights, analysis and previews of tennis action from Wimbledon.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: Compelling stories centered around sports and athletes, ranging from dramatic to comedic.

programme.title: The 2024 ESPYs Nomination Special
programme.desc: Revealing the nominees for the ESPY Awards, which honor the most outstanding athletes, teams, and moments from the past year.

programme.title: Copa Tonight
programme.desc: A preview of each action-packed day in the oldest international tournament in the world.

programme.title: 2024 Copa America
programme.desc: Group C.

programme.title: UEFA European Football Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the European Championship event.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Portugal takes on Slovenia in the round of last 16 of the 2024 European Championships. The only previous meeting between these teams was a 2-0 friendly win for Slovenia last March in Ljubljana. Adam Gnezda Cerin and Timi Elnik scored the goals.

programme.title: 2024 Copa America
programme.desc: Group C.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: France is up against Belgium in the round of last 16 of the 2024 European Championships. France won each of its four major tournament matches against Belgium, including 1-0 in the 2018 World Cup semi-finals. Samuel Umtiti scored the winning goal.

programme.desc: Romania faces Netherlands in the round of last 16 of the 2024 European Championships. The only previous meeting between these teams at the EUROs was in 2008, when Netherlands beat Romania 2-0 in the group stage (goals by Huntelaar and Van Persie).

programme.desc: The Wings and Storm complete their two-game showcase at Climate Pledge Arena. On this day in 2017, Seattle defeated Dallas 89-69. Star forward Nneka Ogwumike, in her first year with Seattle, celebrates her 34th birthday following this contest July 2.

programme.title: Race for the Cup
programme.desc: Relive the best moments of the first ever NBA In-Season Tournament.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James scored 15 of his 31 points in the fourth quarter, and the Los Angeles Lakers secured the last semifinal spot in the inaugural NBA In-Season Tournament with a 106-103 victory over the Phoenix Suns. From Dec. 5, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Tyrese Haliburton had 27 points and 15 assists as the Pacers beat the Bucks, 128-119, to advance to the championship game in the NBA's In-Season Tournament. Giannis Antetokounmpo had 37 points and 10 rebounds to lead Milwaukee. From Dec. 7, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: LeBron James scored 30 points in less than three quarters as the Lakers steamrolled the Pelicans, 133-89, to reach the championship game in the NBA In-Season Tournament. Trey Murphy III led the Pelicans with 14 points. From Dec. 7, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Anthony Davis had season highs of 41 points and 20 rebounds and the Lakers won the inaugural NBA In-Season Tournament with a 123-109 victory over the Pacers. Tyrese Haliburton had 20 points and 11 assists to lead Indiana. From Dec. 9, 2023.

programme.title: Race for the Cup
programme.desc: Relive the best moments of the first ever NBA In-Season Tournament.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Damian Lillard swished a 3-pointer at the buzzer in overtime to give the Milwaukee Bucks a stunning 143-142 win over the Sacramento Kings. From Jan. 14, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Joel Embiid scored a franchise-record 70 points, the most in the NBA this season, to lead the 76ers to a 133-123 victory over the Spurs. Embiid broke Hall of Famer Wilt Chamberlain's 76ers record of 68 points. From Jan. 22, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Stephen Curry hit a 33-footer with 0.7 seconds left to help the Golden State Warriors beat the Suns 113-112 for their fourth straight victory and sixth in seven games. From Feb. 10, 2024.

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: The rise of Summer League in Las Vegas is chronicled in a celebration of 20 years for the NBA's signature event, as superstars such as Stephen Curry, Kevin Durant and Giannis Antetokounmpo would get their start in the Vegas Summer League.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mercury travel for a matchup with the Wings. Phoenix snapped a five-game slide versus Dallas dating to the start of 2023 with a 97-90 win in Texas on June 9. Arike Ogunbowale (DAL) has totaled 65 points in two games against Phoenix this year.

programme.desc: Michael Jordan and Dominique Wilkins compete in the finals of the 1988 Slam Dunk contest from Chicago.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Rookie Kobe Bryant wins his only slam dunk contest. Kobe Bryant, Chris Carr, Michael Finley, Darvin Ham, Ray Allen and Bob Sura compete in the 1997 contest. From Cleveland.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Vince Carter, Steve Francis, Tracy McGrady, Ricky Davis, Jerry Stackhouse and Larry Hughes compete in the 2000 contest. From Oakland, Calif.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Jason Richardson, Desmond Mason, Amar'e Stoudemire and Richard Jefferson compete in 2003 contest. From Atlanta.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Dwight Howard, Gerald Green, Jamario Moon and Rudy Gay compete in the 2008 contest. First time winner was chosen by fan text messages. From New Orleans.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Defending champion Dwight Howard competes against Nate Robinson, J.R. Smith and Rudy Fernandez. From Feb. 15, 2009.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Blake Griffin, Javale McGee, DeMar DeRozan and Serge Ibaka compete in the 2011 contest. Griffin wins the fan vote after jumping over a car with a choir singing "I Believe I can Fly." From Los Angeles.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Zach Lavine, Victor Oladipo, Mason Plumtree and Giannis Antetokounmpo compete in the 2015 contest. Lavine is the second youngest winner of the contest (Kobe Bryant is the youngest). From Brooklyn, N.Y.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Zach LaVine repeats as dunk champion as he defeats Aaron Gordon in an epic showdown. From Feb. 13, 2016.
